intro: Galium scabrum subsp. nitidulum, commonly known as the glossy wood-rose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often glossy and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves and stems are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
